abstract.para: In this chapter you will learn how to install the &admserv; from scratch. It will run on &cloudos; and include the &productname; extension and, optionally, the &smtool; (⪪) server. Prior to starting the installation, refer to and for the requirements.

sect1.title: Starting the Operating System Installation
sect1.para: The following sections will only cover the differences from the default installation process.

sect1.title: Registration and Online Updates
sect1.para: Registering &cloudos; during the installation process is required for getting product updates and for installing the &productname; extension. Refer to the SUSE Customer Center Registration section of the &cloudos; Deployment Guide for further instructions.

After having successfully registered you will be asked whether to add the update repositories. If you agree, the latest updates will automatically be installed, ensuring that your system is on the latest patch level after the initial installation. It is strongly recommended to add the update repositories now. If you choose to skip, you need to perform an online update later, before starting the &inst_crow;.

note.title: &suse; Login Required
note.para: To register a product, you need to have a &suse; login. If you do not have such a login, create it at .

sect1.title: Installing the &productname; Extension
sect1.para: &cloud; is an extension to &sls;. Installing it during the &sls; installation is the easiest and recommended way to set up the &admserv;. To get access to the extension selection dialog, you need to register &cloudos; during the installation. After a successful registration, the &cloudos; installation continues with the Extension & Module Selection. Choose &productname; &productnumber; and provide the registration key you have obtained by purchasing &productname;. The registration and the extension installation require an Internet connection.

sect1.title: Partitioning
sect1.para: Currently, &crow; requires /opt to be writable. It is also recommended to create a separate partition or volume formatted with XFS for /srv with a size of at least &repospace;.

The default file system on &cloudos; is Btrfs with snapshots enabled. &productname; installs into /opt, a directory that is excluded from snapshots. Reverting to a snapshot may therefore break the &productname; installation. It is recommended to disable Btrfs snapshots on the &admserv;.
Help on using the partitioning tool is available at the section Using the YaST Partitioner of the &cloudos; Deployment Guide.

sect1.title: Installation Settings
sect1.para: The final installation step, Installation Settings, lets you configure various settings. For the &admserv; setup, you need to adjust the software selection and the firewall settings. For more information refer to the Installation Settings section of the &cloudos; Deployment Guide.

tip.title: Installing a Local ⪪ Server (Optional)
tip.para: In case you do not have a &susemgr; or ⪪ server in your organization or are planning to manually update the repositories required for deployment of the &cloud; nodes, you need to set up an ⪪ server on the &admserv;. Choose the pattern Subscription Management Tool in addition to the patterns listed above to install the ⪪ server software.

sect2.title: Firewall Settings
sect2.para: &productname; requires to disable the firewall on the &admserv;. You can disable the firewall now in the Firewall and SSH section. In case your environment requires a firewall to be active at this stage of the installation, you can postpone disabling the firewall until doing the final network configuration (see ). Optionally you can also enable SSH access to the admin server here.
